result.markdown:
## Tidy Results from a List of Estimators {.unnumbered} ### Description This function applies 'tidy_estimator' to a named list of models, extracting and tidying results for each model and combining them into a single data frame. ### Usage 
tidy_estimator_list(
  model_list,
  vcov = NULL,
  alpha = 0.05,
  null = 0,
  term = NULL
)
### Arguments
model_list A named list of fitted model objects. Each model is passed to 'tidy_estimator'.
vcov An optional variance-covariance matrix or a function to compute it. Passed to 'tidy_estimator'.
alpha A numeric value between 0 and 1 specifying the significance level for confidence intervals (default is 0.05).
null A numeric value representing the null hypothesis for the parameter estimates (default is 0).
term An optional character vector of terms to filter the output. If specified, only rows with matching terms are returned.
### Value A data frame combining the tidied results from all models in the list. Columns include:
estimator
The label for the estimator (corresponding to the list names).
term
The name of the parameter (e.g., model term).
estimate
The estimated value of the parameter.
p.value
The p-value for the hypothesis test of the parameter.
conf.low
The lower bound of the confidence interval.
conf.high
The upper bound of the confidence interval.
### Examples ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library("SimpleDesign") library(SimpleDesign) model1 <- lm(mpg ~ wt, data = mtcars) model2 <- lm(mpg ~ disp, data = mtcars) models <- list(OLS_wt = model1, OLS_disp = model2) tidy_estimator_list(models, alpha = 0.05, null = 0) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` estimator term estimate p.value conf.low conf.high 1 OLS_wt (Intercept) 37.28512617 9.477721e-88 33.60504421 40.9652081 2 OLS_wt wt -5.34447157 1.188493e-21 -6.44028949 -4.2486537 3 OLS_disp (Intercept) 29.59985476 5.104094e-128 27.18964880 32.0100607 4 OLS_disp disp -0.04121512 2.188058e-18 -0.05045014 -0.0319801 ``` ::: :::
